Articles.Content:
What mods are you using, because the stock EWBCL Block 4 doesnt explode.

I have just a few:

  • Active Texture Management
  • Environmental Visual Enhancements
  • Better Atmospheres V5
  • Deadly Reentry
  • FAR
  • KSO

I have just a few:

  • Active Texture Management
  • Environmental Visual Enhancements
  • Better Atmospheres V5
  • Deadly Reentry
  • FAR
  • KSO

DRE is probably the cause of your issues. It messes with the max temperatures of parts.

Okay, so is there a solution to the exploding EFT when you separate the boosters?

I do a test separation on the launchpad and nothing bad happens, but when I do it mid-flight, the EFT always blows up and it's frustrating because the KSO doesn't have enough fuel in its internal tank to even circularize enough to survive a reentry with DRE.

If you check your EFT temperature just prior to separation, I think you'll find that it's already pretty hot.

The cause of the heating is that you've gone supersonic and if your altitude is too low then your temperature can be quite substantial. You need to either modify your flight profile so that you've got more altitude by the time you jettison boosters. More altitude means thinner air and lower temperatures.

Or, throttle down so that you're not going so fast until you get higher up. Also, DREC lowers part temperatures for a lot of parts, especially if their max temps were above a certain threshold..

Not going to happen.

The EWBCL was designed so you could launch other 2.5m parts (like the stock station components or FusTek) with the KSO system.

Wow ok then...I guess I didnt realize that I was being rude or that I was making you mad about it...

Edited June 29, 2014 by Rassa Farlander

If you check your EFT temperature just prior to separation, I think you'll find that it's already pretty hot.

The cause of the heating is that you've gone supersonic and if your altitude is too low then your temperature can be quite substantial. You need to either modify your flight profile so that you've got more altitude by the time you jettison boosters. More altitude means thinner air and lower temperatures.

Or, throttle down so that you're not going so fast until you get higher up. Also, DREC lowers part temperatures for a lot of parts, especially if their max temps were above a certain threshold..

Yeah, I guess I wasn't noticing the temperature prior to separation. Also, in your DRE config, not all the gear are shielded and one wing isn't shielded either. I dropped your config into a .cfg file and let module manager do its thing. I hope that was the right installation process for it and that I didn't mess it up (and that being the reason why I'm not seeing the shielding).

Okay, so is there a solution to the exploding EFT when you separate the boosters?

I do a test separation on the launchpad and nothing bad happens, but when I do it mid-flight, the EFT always blows up and it's frustrating because the KSO doesn't have enough fuel in its internal tank to even circularize enough to survive a reentry with DRE.

You're using 4 boosters right? I use only 2... when I use 4 it gets hypersonic...

the problem is with either DRE or Ferram the sepatrons on the boosters overheat the fuel tank in the middle. Simply move the position of the sepatrons so that they don't point into the tank and it should work fine.

Yeah, I guess I wasn't noticing the temperature prior to separation. Also, in your DRE config, not all the gear are shielded and one wing isn't shielded either. I dropped your config into a .cfg file and let module manager do its thing. I hope that was the right installation process for it and that I didn't mess it up (and that being the reason why I'm not seeing the shielding).

There was a time at which there was an unshielded wing but I thought I fixed that before sending it off to you. I'll send you another.

You're using 4 boosters right? I use only 2... when I use 4 it gets hypersonic...

I'm just using two boosters. But using FAR significantly reduces drag.

There was a time at which there was an unshielded wing but I thought I fixed that before sending it off to you. I'll send you another.

Okay, cool, sounds good.

Wow ok then...I guess I didnt realize that I was being rude or that I was making you mad about it...

Im far from mad. Nor were you being rude, but helldiver has stated several times that the EWBCL was created to allow people to use the KSO system to launch other 2.5m components. There are no plans to make larger KSO station parts or adapters for the current parts.

Im far from mad. Nor were you being rude, but helldiver has stated several times that the EWBCL was created to allow people to use the KSO system to launch other 2.5m components. There are no plans to make larger KSO station parts or adapters for the current parts.

Though, if a person really wanted some sort of adapter for those parts.... isnt there some suitable stock pieces?

Though, if a person really wanted some sort of adapter for those parts.... isnt there some suitable stock pieces?

I just used the stock modular girder adapter to go from round to square and the KSOS Station Power Module or the Station Docking Module to go from octagon to round (although it's not 2.5m round as what's being requested but there is a stock adapter for that) depending on whether I want the crew capacity or the resources.
Yea I made it work with the rockomax adapter, it still just doesnt look quite right,But Im just being picky I guess lolz

For anybody having issues modifying the blank texture using GIMP where they get random black pixels, here's how I got it to work:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited June 29, 2014 by qnistNAMEERF

What would be nice is, if you can make a download for the three phases separately and without all the other requirements. I'd like to use the Shuttles but I don't need the station parts and I think I'm not the only one who has most of the other mods required for it to work!

idont know if it is issue with stock game or something with KSO parts but i suddenly found out that i cant dock my service tug. it uses standard KSO docking port and of course i want to dock it to same one.

after i undock from where tug was previously attached, i cant dock back to this port and to other ports. as i get close, magnetism doesnt works. i just bump and fly away.

anyone else experienced it?

idont know if it is issue with stock game or something with KSO parts but i suddenly found out that i cant dock my service tug. it uses standard KSO docking port and of course i want to dock it to same one.

after i undock from where tug was previously attached, i cant dock back to this port and to other ports. as i get close, magnetism doesnt works. i just bump and fly away.

anyone else experienced it?

Yeah but in my case it was with a KSO and stock docking port. I sent up a replacement and that fixed it.

idont know if it is issue with stock game or something with KSO parts but i suddenly found out that i cant dock my service tug. it uses standard KSO docking port and of course i want to dock it to same one.

after i undock from where tug was previously attached, i cant dock back to this port and to other ports. as i get close, magnetism doesnt works. i just bump and fly away.

anyone else experienced it?

short explanation

edit your save file. find that docking port (s) and set its state to Ready

long answer, if you cant figure out how to do that I'll find the thread that tells you how to fix your ports but I'm on an ipad as I wait for reentry while I test the KSO25 and my heat shield config with RSS/FAR

Edit: and yes, its a known stock problem. more likely to occur with space station structures where you have lots of docking and undocking happening.

Edited June 29, 2014 by Starwaster
64-bit support had better come soon, even Active Texture Management can't save me without forcing me to cut out a handful of mods.
64-bit support had better come soon, even Active Texture Management can't save me without forcing me to cut out a handful of mods.
Hey helldiver, can you put an "embedded" communications antenna in the shuttles for SCIENCE? That'd be awesome. Besides, the IRL Shuttle had its own antenna.
Tweaked the FAR config a little. Fell out of the sky like a stone. Maybe I'll have to cheat to create more wing area. Too bad FAR is so picky about the cargo bay that testing gets difficult.

Tweaked the FAR config a little. Fell out of the sky like a stone. Maybe I'll have to cheat to create more wing area. Too bad FAR is so picky about the cargo bay that testing gets difficult.

Yeah, I tried taking off with an empty KSO (infinite fuel) from the runway with your FAR config and it just doesn't seem to generate enough lift to keep itself airborne. The FAR config will undoubtedly require cheating to manufacture a wing area that generates suitable lift.

What would be nice is, if you can make a download for the three phases separately and without all the other requirements. I'd like to use the Shuttles but I don't need the station parts and I think I'm not the only one who has most of the other mods required for it to work!

I made a script that'll do this in windows, or you can use the part lists on that page to separate them yourself. Just install each phase individually. It installs the plugins required as well, though.

I made a script that'll do this in windows, or you can use the part lists on that page to separate them yourself. Just install each phase individually. It installs the plugins required as well, though.

Yeah that works fantastic. Adding it to 3.09 once I get that up.
